meanings.definition: The state or quality of being torose.
meanings.sent1: The torosity of the tree branches made them look like twisted ropes.
meanings.sent2: The torosity of the maze confused the visitors.
meanings.sent3: The torosity of the river's path seemed to play a trick on the lost hikers.
meanings.sent4: The torosity of the old staircase added a sense of mystery to the abandoned house.
meanings.sent5: The torosity of the ancient tree roots created a mesmerizing pattern on the forest floor.

meanings.definition: The condition of being full of twists or turns.
meanings.sent1: The torosity of the mountain road made driving challenging.
meanings.sent2: The torosity of the plot kept the audience engaged till the end of the movie.
meanings.sent3: The torosity of the garden path led to unexpected discoveries around every bend.
meanings.sent4: The torosity of the conversation took unexpected turns, leaving everyone surprised.
meanings.sent5: The torosity of the rollercoaster track added excitement to the amusement park ride.

meanings.definition: The property of having a twisted or convoluted shape.
meanings.sent1: The torosity of the seashell fascinated the young beachcombers.
meanings.sent2: The torosity of the ancient artifact hinted at its intricate craftsmanship.
meanings.sent3: The torosity of the tangled wires made it difficult to untangle them.
meanings.sent4: The torosity of the mountain range created a breathtaking silhouette against the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The torosity of the labyrinth walls added to the challenge of finding the exit.
